byline.contributor: David Montgomery contributed reporting from Austin, Tex., and Kitty Bennett contributed research from New York.

abstract: Geneva Reed-Veal files federal suit naming several parties as responsible for wrongful death of her daughter, Sandra Bland, who was found dead in jail cell after being arrested in ordinary traffic stop; suit names Texas State Trooper Brian T Encinia, Waller County, two guards at county's jail and state Dept of Public Safety.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit faults the state trooper who arrested Ms. Bland, who died in a Texas jail cell last month, and the jail guards who were supposed to keep watch over her.

headline.main: Sandra Bland’s Mother Files Wrongful-Death Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Faulting Trooper and County, Mother of Sandra Bland Files Wrongful-Death Suit

snippet: The lawsuit faults the state trooper who arrested Ms. Bland, who died in a Texas jail cell last month, and the jail guards who were supposed to keep watch over her.
